alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Natrona County through 445 PM MDT... At 419 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Red Butte, which is also near Casper, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Paradise Valley around 425 PM MDT. Mills around 430 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Casper, Beartrap Meadows County Park and Evansville. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 184 and 191. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations
